column3: What is the cost of enabling IPv6 Ip addresses in your VPC
column4: This is included as part of IPAM free tier

column3: What is the hourly rate for an in usage public ipv4 address
column4: It is 0.005 cents an hour. So about 12 cents a day

column3: AWS Lattice is an {{c1::application}} networking service. It is a {{c2::fully}} managed service that allows you to connect secure and monitor accross mulitple accounts and VPCs
AWS services can be classified into two main types, Public and Private. True or False?
The distinction between AWS Public and Private services purely referes to network accessability. True or false
Describe the three broad zones of how we can classify AWS Services relationship with the internet
column4:
1. We have the Private Zone. These are resources hosted on a VPC that need something like an internet Gateway to get out into the public internet
2. We have the Public Zone. These are AWS services with public endpoints. They have direct connections to the AWS Private zone but can be reached over the Public internet
3. The public internet. The Wider network that is the World Wide Web

column3: What is the difference between AWS Regions and Edge Locations?
column4:
AWS Regions are geographically distributed. They are isolated from each other and located within National Boundaries
Edge locations are much smaller than regions and generally only have content distribution services and some types of edge computing.

column3: What are the three main benefits of AWS Regions
column4:
1. Regions are Geographically ISOLATED. This contributes to fault tolerance and availability.
2. Geopolitical sepearation. Allows data soveiginty and governance.
3. Regions give location control, allowing infrastructure to be placed close to customers.

column3: What permissions does an AMI have?
column4: Public Access, Owner Only, Specific AWS Accounts

column3: What is true of an AWS Public Service
column4:
1. Located in the AWS Public Zone
2. Anyone can connect over the network but application level permissions will still matter.

column3: Can S3 buckets store an unlimited amount of Data?
How many root DNS servers exist?
column4: 13 different servers managed by 12 large organisations

column3: Route 53 is a Global service? True or false
column4: Yes Route53 is a Global service. It operates from a single database and as such you do not need to specify a region when using the service.

column3: What Cloud Formation YAML sytax is associated with the AWSTemplateFormatVersion and the Description Field
column4: If both are included then Description must FOLLOW AWSTemplateFormatVersion

column3: What is the difference between CloudFormation Templates and a CloudFormation Stack
column4: A CloudFormation Template is a yaml or json file that specifies the Logical Resources as inputs to the Cloud Formation Service. The CloudFormation service creates an internal representation of this called a CloudFormation Stack which maps the Logical Resources in a CF template to the Physical Resources created by Cloud Formation.

column3: How do you control the allocation of vCPU in an AWS Lambda?
column4: AWS Lambda CPU allocation is scaled with memory allocation and cannot be

column3:
What is the largest number of lambdas an account can have?
a) 1000 per account
b) Unlimited
c) 75 GB of deployed content per Region
d) 100 per Availability Zone
Correct:{{c1:: c}}

What range of memory can be allocated to a lambda function?
a) 128 MB to 10,240 MB
b) 20 MB to 20,000 MB
c) 16GB to 64 GB
d) Depends on AWS Region
Correct:{{c1:: a}}

If a lambda function is CPU or network bound how can you increase it's performance?
a) Update the DPU allocation
b) It can only be split into more workloads
c) Increase it's memory allocation as CPU scales with memory
d) Request to run on a different hypervisor
Correct:{{c1:: c}}

How are lambdas charged for?
a) CPU + Network + Memory Usage per run
b) Priced per 1000 invocations
c) CPU time per function
d) Total amount of gigabyte-seconds per function
Correct:{{c1:: d}}

What is true of the isolation model for the Lambda service?
a) A single Lambda invocation runs in multiple execution environments
b) An execution environment is discarded after its Lambda invocation finishes
c) There are no shared file storage between lambda invocations
d) Execution environments run on MicroVMs dedicated to a single AWS Account
Correct:{{c1:: d}}

What part of the local file system is shared between Lamda invocations running on the same execution environment?
a) /tmp
b) /root
c) There are no shared file storage between lambda invocations
d) /home/lambda
Correct:{{c1:: a}}

When is Memory leakage between lambda invocations possible?
a) It is never possible. The lambda service scrubs memory between each invocation.
b) When using third party libraries in multiple invocations in the same execution environment.
c) Global Variables and objects stored in the INIT phase
d) Only when the lambda warm start feature is enabled.
Correct:{{c1:: b is the answer. C is true but not the answer. Others are just wrong}}

Which of the following are true about CloudTrail trails?
a) Single Region trails can be generated in the console
b) Trails log data events by default
c) An optional log validation feature can be used to pass digests to S3
d) Trails logged to an S3 bucket are stored in text format
Correct:{{c1:: Only c is true}}

What is true of Cloud Trail logs?
a) CloudTrail can integrate with CloudWatch
b) CloudWatch is not RealTime
c) CloudTrail only logs management events by default
d) Trails logged to an S3 bucket are stored in text format
Correct:{{c1:: a, b and c are true}}

What does CloudTrail enable?
a) The logging of AWS API events such as log ons and resource deletions
b) Successful SSH connections
c) Successful codecommit commits
d) DDOS attacks
Correct:{{c1:: a is true. Not sure about c}}

Which of the following is Enabled by default on CloudTrail
a) 90 day logging of Managment events
b) 30 day logging of Data Events
c) Integration with CloudWatch
d) S3 object access calls
Correct:{{c1:: a is true }}
What is AWS STS
column4:
AWS Security Token Service is an integral part of the AWS IAM set of Services. It is used to provide shortlived access tokens to trusted users. Examples of API calls it supports include:
GetFederationToken
GetSessionToken
AssumeRole

column3:
AWS Xray can be configured to trace requests an application makes to other AWS services. Which AWS services are compatible with Xray?
a) Lambda
b) Amazon EC2
c) Amazon S3
d) Amazon ECS
Correct:{{c1:: a, b, d}}

How does AWS facilitate the network connectivity of lamdas configured within a VPC?
a) An ENI is created for each function invocation within the subnet
b) A lambda gatway is configured within the VPC by which all functions can connect to the VPC
c) AWS analyses all functions for a given account and region and creates ENIs for each security group and subnet
d) Lambda functions are public and cannot be configured within a VPC
Correct:{{c1:: c}}

The AWS Lambda service requires an {{c1::execution policy}} to access {{c2::AWS services}}. As well as this the Lambda service can be configured with {{c3::Resource Policies}} which {{c4::allow other accounts to invoke the lambda}}.

Which of the following would be required to host a lambda in a VPC with public internet access and access to a database in a private subnet?
a) An IAM role to allow the Lambda service to create Elastic Network Interfaces in a VPC
b) The Lambda needs to be configured to be in the private databases subnet
c) There needs to be a public subnet in the VPC
d) There needs to be a NAT gateway in the public subnet
Correct:{{c1:: a,b,c,d (You should try and configure this)}}

By default Lambda functions are given public networking. What does this mean?
a) AWS Lambda functions have network access to AWS services in the public zone
b) Internet users can invoke the Lambda functions via Lambda function URLs
c) Other AWS accounts can invoke your Lambda function
d) Lambda functions have access to the Open internet
Correct:{{c1:: a,d}}

What is true of the AWS Lambda service?
a) The Lambda service is a serverless service
b) The Lambda service is a managed service
c) Lambda functions are a Software as a Service
d) The Lambda service is a global service
Correct:{{c1:: a,b}}

What is true of AWS Service Control Polices?
a) They are a type of IAM policy
b) They grant access to AWS resources
c)They apply to users in the management account.
d) SCPs set maximum permissions for IAM users and roles within an Organization
Correct:{{c1:: d}}

What is true of AWS Service Control Polices?
a) If an account is using an IAM permissions boundary the Service Control Polices are overridden.
b) SCPs are available only in an Organisation that has all features enabled.
c)Along with Resource Control Polices (RCPs) SCPs are used to set maximum permissions for IAM users and roles within an AWS Organisation.
d) SCPs are written in yaml format.
Correct:{{c1:: b,c}}
What is AWS Multi Session Support?
column4: A browser feature that allows different sessions in the same browser using different identities. Allowed by use of subdomains

column3:
To enable high resolution the argument $RES in the command `aws cloudwatch put-metric-data` --namespace test --value 1 --metric-name test_metric --storage-resolution $RES should be?
a) 1
b) HIGH
c) 60
d) MAXIMUM
Correct:{{c1:: a}}

What is the limit on the file size in an instance of Elastic File System?
a) Unlimited
b) 5 TB
c) 47.9 TiB (>50TB)
d) 10 TiB (~10TB, <11TB)
Correct:{{c1:: c}}

What is the limit on the file size in an EBS volume?
a) Unlimited
b) 5 TB
c) 47.9 TiB (>50TB)
d) 10 TiB (~10TB, <11TB)
Correct:{{c1:: a}}

What is the size limit of an S3 object?
a) Unlimited
b) 5 TB
c) 47.9 TiB (>50TB)
d) 10 TiB (~10TB, <11TB)
Correct:{{c1:: b}}

An organisation wants to store vast quantities of data with the data accessible to users over HTTPS? What service would be best?
a) EFS
b) AWS RDS
c) S3
d) EBS
Correct:{{c1:: c [S3 can store an unlimited amount of data and make it available of https]}}

What is true of the difference between CloudWatch resolution and monitoring concepts?
a) Resolution is an older concept decomissioned from 2019
b) Resolution and Monitoring are synonyms
c) Monitoring is an API level operation
d) Custom appliactions cannot integrate with CloudWatch using basic monitoring
Correct:{{c1:: d [c is wrong. Custom metrics can have a user specified resolution. Monitoring is a service level feature]}}

What S3 feature must also be enabled to use the Object Lock (WORM) feature?
a) Server Side Encryption
b) CloudTrail Data Events
c) MFA Delete
d) Bucket Versioning
Correct:{{c1:: d}}
What feature does enabling requester pays on an S3 bucket disble?

Which of the below are S3 Bucket classes?
a) Table Buckets
b) Directory Buckets
c) Tape Buckets
d) General Purpose Buckets
Correct:{{c1:: a,b,d}}

A CloudWatch Namespace:
a) Represents a time-ordered set of data points that are published to CloudWatch.
b) Is a container for CloudWatch metrics.
c) A name/value pair that is part of the identity of a metric.
d) The length of time associated with a specific Amazon CloudWatch statistic.
Correct:{{c1:: b}}

A CloudWatch Log group is?
a) Something to extract metric observations from ingested events and transform them to data points in a CloudWatch metric.
b) Define sets of log streams that share the same retention, monitoring, and access control settings. Each log stream has to belong to one.
c) A name/value pair that is part of the identity of a metric.
d) A record of some activity recorded by the application or resource being monitored.
Correct:{{c1:: b}}

What is the Hard limit on the number of IAM users an Account can have?
a) 5000
b) 200
c) 10000
d) 20
Correct:{{c1:: a)}}

What is a real difference between IAM Identity Centre and IAM
a) IAM IC has a soft limit of 100,000 users
b) IAM is used for federating with Identity Providers
c) IAM has a hard limit of 5000 users
d) You can create groups using IAM IC
Correct:{{c1:: a,c}}

What service would you use to federate AWS Quicksight access with your on Prem Active Directory Instance?
a) AWS Congnito
b) IAM
c) AWS Organisations
d) IAM Identity Centre
Correct:{{c1:: d}}

What is the differece between Dynamo DB Provisioned Capcaity Mode and On Demand Mode?
a) You cannot use auto Scaling in Provisioned Capcity mode
b) On Demand is best for unpredictable capacity
c) You do not have to specify Read Write Capacity for On demand mode
d) Using On Demand you par per request.
Correct:{{c1:: b,c,d}}

When is it possible to restrict what the root user can do?
a) Always
b) Never
c) If AWS Organistions is used
d) If AWS Organistions is used but not the managment account root
Correct:{{c1:: d}}

What class of database is Amazon Redshift?
a) Online Analytical Processing (OLAP)
b) Online Transactional Processing (OLTP)
c) NoSQL
d) Vector Database
Correct:{{c1:: a}}

What scale does AWS Redshift Cater to?
a) 100 TBs
b) Multiple Petabytes (>1,<200)
c) 100s of Petabytes
d) Exabytes
Correct:{{c1:: b}}

What is the maximum size that an EBS volume can scale to?
a) 64 TiB
b) 1 TiB
c) 49Tib
d) 5TB
Correct:{{c1:: a}}

How many regions within an AWS organisation can support an IAM Identity Centre instance?
a) 1
b) 100
c) 3
d) 10
Correct:{{c1:: a}}

What are appropriate situations to make use of AWS Roles?
a) Avoid giving AWS Services Hardcoded credentials
b) Break Glass situations
c) Cross account Access
d) Web Identity Federation
Correct:{{c1:: a,b,c,d}}

What is true of the difference between a service role and a service Linked role?
a) service linked roles cannot be deleted by IAM or root users.
b) service roles are pre-defined by AWS
c) Service linked roles are pre-defined by AWS
d) Service linked roles cannot be passed using the PassRole Permision
Correct:{{c1:: a,c}}

What is a service role?
a) A IAM role assumed by an IAM user
b) A role created by AWS for a given service
c) A role assumed by a Federated user
d) An IAM role assumed by a service
Correct:{{c1:: d}}

What is the purpose of roles trust policy?
a) Controls what actions a role can perform
b) Associates a role with trusted entities
c) Controls what entities a role can be associated with
d) Controls what resources a role can modify
Correct:{{c1:: c}}

What feature of NoSQL Datbases makes them useful for storing Application state?
a) Write Once Read Many
b) Low access latency
c) horizontal scalability OOTB
d) Allows complex queries to be handled by the DB
Correct:{{c1:: b,c}}
